intro: [WRONG START] Cirsium acrolephis, commonly known as the rough thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs and have a rough, spiny texture, while its flowers are usually purple or pink in color. The plant produces achenes as its fruit, which are dispersed by wind, aiding in its propagation.
